Race.SpecificTitle: Councilman at Large -- Seat D, City of Thibodaux
Town of Golden Meadow(#1) -- Prop. #1 -TC- Sell Assests & Grant Franchise
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 1

Summary:  Authority for the Town of Golden Meadow, State of Louisiana, to sell certain assets of its gas utility to South Coast Gas Company, Inc. for consideration that includes $25,000 in cash, and to grant to South Coast Gas Company, Inc. an exclusive franchise to construct, own and operate a gas utility in the Town of Golden Meadow as per written proposal dated August 13, 2008, on file in the office of the clerk of said town
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Golden Meadow, State of Louisiana, sell certain assets of its gas utility to South Coast Gas Company, Inc. for consideration that includes $25,000 in cash, and grant to South Coast Gas Company, Inc. an exclusive franchise to operate a gas utility in the Town of Golden Meadow as per written proposal dated August 13, 2008, on file in the office of the clerk of said town?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Golden Meadow(#2) -- Prop. #2 -TC- Surrender powers of supervision
Race.SummaryText:
Proposition No. 2

Summary:  Authority for the Town of Golden Meadow, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), in the event it sells assets of its gas utility to South Coast Gas Company, Inc. in accordance with its written and signed proposal dated August 13, 2008, to surrender the Town's powers of supervision, regulation and control over the gas distribution system in the Town of Golden Meadow to the Louisiana Public Service Commission.
Race.FullText: In the event the Town of Golden Meadow, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), sells assets of its gas utility to South Coast Gas Company, Inc. in accordance with its written and signed proposal dated August 13, 2008, shall the Town be authorized under authority of Subpart A, Part IV, Chapter 10, Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950 as amended, to surrender its powers of supervision, regulation and control over the gas distribution system in the Town of Golden Meadow to the Louisiana Public Service Commission?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. District No.3 -- 8 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 3 Proposition
(Tax Continuation and Rededication)

Summary: 10 year, 8 mills property tax continuation and rededication for acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities and equipment and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, said tax to be a rededication of an 8 mills tax authorized to be levied by the District through the year 2008.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 3 of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy an eight (8) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (the "Tax") for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2009 and ending with the year 2018 (an estimated $2,680,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities and equipment and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, said tax to be a rededication of an 8 mills tax authorized to be levied by the District through the year 2008 by an election held on January 17, 1998?
